subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] To Paul
msgSnippet: Hi Erik, Paul adopted an admirable modesty when he mentioned reading the news in QS. It s only through enormous effort on his part that we are able to do so.
messageBody:
Hi Erik,

Paul adopted an admirable modesty when he mentioned reading the news
in QS. It's only through enormous effort on his part that we are able
to do so. Check this location for news files that are updated daily:

http://quikscript.sourceforge.net/

Ted


On Nov 30, 2007 5:46 PM, Erik Felker <ejfelker@...> wrote:
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Thanks for your response. I see at least part of what you mean about
> phonemic/phonetic, but the situation sounds like a bit of a blend of
> the two, since our ways of speaking are often unconscious, and I
> assume that when we are writing in QS, we are listening to our own
> internal voices--for example, your internal voice that does not make
> the sound distinction that you mentioned, and my internal voice that
> does. I can also see QS as an excellent way of reproducing regional
> accents for literary purposes. I can see that this is going to be
> quite an intellectual adventure!
>
> By the way, where do you find the news in QS?
>
> Also, I am still wondering if QS is being used as a way to help
> non-English-speakers learn how to pronounce British or American
> English... (English as a foreign language is an interest of mine, and
> a subject in which I have some tutoring experience.)
>
> Thanks for helping me explore this absorbing topic!
>
>
